ygData.subject: Re: Undocumented Everfrost Location
ygData.msgSnippet: No, that is not where the Giangantic Zweihander comes from. The GZ comes off of Karg Icebear, a powerful wandering Barbarian NPC in Everfrost. ... From: Avron
ygData.messageBody:
No, that is not where the Giangantic Zweihander comes from. The GZ comes off of Karg Icebear, a powerful wandering Barbarian NPC in Everfrost.
----- Original Message -----
From: Avron
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Sent: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 3:44 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Undocumented Everfrost Location



This cave is not completely undiscovered, I believe this is where you find the giant zweihander, I think it is off that necro, you need a group of high level 30's to pull it off too..
- Avron -


"Whitmore, Lance" wrote:


If you head north where the river comes to the mountain, take a look thru the ice and you will see the cave. Sometimes you will see a goblin swimming at the mouth of the cave. The cave itself is inside the mountain, so as you swim it will eventauly open up above the surface of the water.

I believe that the NPC Necro's con was aggressive and he was red at lvl 16. Be careful when approaching him. BTW there is very little light, and it is a maze ( oh what fun... hehe)

I never zoned so i dont believe its a new zone, just undiscovered.. the cave itself is quite large (or it seemed that way) but was relativly empty. This is what i saw:

1.. House with 4 icebone skeletons
2.. Shrine ( zone point )structure protected by 2 icebones skeletons
3.. Human NPC Necromancer with pet - red at lvl 16
4.. Possible Giant.. (type unknown) - I never saw one myself

And, there could be more to the cave that went unexplored, because i had no way of passing the Necro at the time. I was informed of the cave by a fellow player. She stated that she had seen a giant, but alass i have not.

Good Luck
